item.title: Tourists | 20 million mark hit a month before
item.description:
More than 20 million tourists have visited Macau since the beginning of the year. The brand was exceeded yesterday morning, 26 days earlier than in 2024. So far, the daily average of entries this year has been 106 thousand visitors. More than 90 percent arrive from the interior of China and Hong Kong
Compared to 2024, Macao reached this year the milestone of 20 million tourists entering the territory almost a month earlier. According to data released yesterday by the Public Security Police (CPSP), the 20 million tourists who crossed the border to Macau was beaten at 11am yesterday, 26 days earlier than last year. Made the accounts, this total registration gives a daily average of 106,000 tourists. If the average tourists visiting Macau daily is added to the city's population, visitors represent 13.35 percent of people in the territory. CPSP data also show that among tourists who visited Macau since the beginning of the year, until yesterday at the end of the morning, 90.7 percent came from the interior of China and Hong Kong. Unsurprisingly, visitors from the countryside are the vast majority, 71.6 percent, followed by Hong Kong (19.1 percent), while Taiwan came 2.4 percent of visitors. International tourists represented only 6.9 percent of all entries since the beginning of the year. In terms of entry points, the siege door border post remains the busiest, totaling 41 percent of tourist entrances, followed by the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau border with 24.1 percent and 13.5 percent hengqin. Among the times According to data from the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC), in the first five months of this year 16.3 million tourists came to Macao, the second highest amount ever for a year, only surpassed by registration between January and May 2019 -before the COVID -19 pandemic -during which it recorded almost 17.2 million visitors. Combaging DSEC and CPSP data, it is concluded that during June and the first week of July, about 3.7 million people entered. CPSP yesterday added that the number of tourists expects during the summer holidays. As such, it reinforced cooperation with the immigration and border inspection departments of the interior of China and Hong Kong to ensure safe, ordered and unsuccessful crossings.

item.title: HK | BRANDS CASE INVOLVES DON DON DONKI DE MACAU
item.description:
A maid of a Hong Kong consultant confessed in court that he received bribes from companies hired to renew two Japanese product stores. The two projects exceeded $ 25 million from Hong Kong, of which 23.4 million went to the Don Doki project at Fai Chi Kei
On July 21, the Kowloon City Court in Hong Kong will reveal the judgment of a trial that places a maid of a company of design consultancy and leaders from two companies in a case where the region's authorities claim a bribery scheme to get renewal contracts for two stores: Tokyo Lifestyle in Kowloon and the supermarket from the Donki Japan jail in Macau. According to a statement from the Independent Commission Against Corruption (ICAC) from Hong Kong, last Monday, Pian Pang Ka-Shin, Marketing Manager of K&C Creation Limited (KCL), stood guilty in court of receiving 230,000 dollars from Hong Kong to ensure that the two companies got the renewal contracts of the stores that would be worth a total of 25 million dollars. From Hong Kong. The case has three more defendants, leaders of the two companies that got the contracts, and began to be tried at the Kowloon City Court last February. Lifestyles In 2019, the KLC was in charge of the two renewal projects and, at that time, Pian Pang Ka-Shin was the company's head of coordinating competitions to find companies that would be responsible for the work in both stores. The defendant was in charge of presenting the proposals and budgets of competing companies for selection of KLC and Donki Japan. According to ICAC, Pang confessed to receiving between June 2019 and January 2022 bribes more than $ 230,000 from Hong Kong from three companies' leaders to help them get contracts for the projects. In the Tokyo Lifestyle renewal contest, Pian Pang Ka-Shin submitted two proposals, but following the manager's recommendation, RNK eventually got the contract worth $ 1.7 million from Hong Kong. The largest volume project was really the commercial space at Fai Chi Kei. There, Pang helped the company that would eventually have the contract, the Fel, to submit the proposal to get the project worth $ 23.4 million from Hong Kong. The three leaders of the companies that will have allegedly bribed to the manager declared themselves innocent in court. Don Don Donki at Fai Chi Kei opened September 2021 in the middle of pandemic. With strong border restrictions, the opening of the Japanese supermarket was viewed by the population as an opportunity to travel without leaving Macao. For wide weeks, the imposition of multitudes prevention and control measures was not enough to originate long lines of customers to enter the opened store 24 hours a day. In February last year, the brand opened a second store in Macau at Studio City.

item.title: Elections | Alberto Wong complains about defamation campaign
item.description:
The social worker also states that he has filed a complaint with the Judicial Police, after starting to circulate online comments that connect him to investments with investments in Myanmar and the debts left to pay
Alberto Wong, a candidate for deputy who leads the Liveliod Popular Strength list in Macao, claims to be the victim of a defamation campaign on social networks, after some comments accuse him of having practiced mockery or leaving debts to pay. In a publication on social networks, the social worker also revealed that he filed a complaint to the Judicial Police (PJ). "The statements to circulate on social networks aimed at my person have been made with malice and are slanderous, so they severely violate my personal dignity. Therefore, there are suspicions that the perpetrators committed the crimes of defamation and injury," wrote Alberto Wong. "I already denounced the cases to the PJ and delivered with the complaint the materials published online. The criminal case has already been installed," he said. According to Wong, the PJ will now start an investigation and follow the tracks left by the profiles that made the comments considered defamatory by the candidate. At the same time, Alberto Wong appealed to those who published the controversial comments to remove them immediately from the internet and apologize to him to “mitigate the impact” of the accusations he considers to be slander. New candidate In recent days, with the approaching elections to the Legislative Assembly of September 14, online comments came up with Albert Wong to Burla schemes. Some of the accusations claimed that Wong would have promoted real estate investments in Myanmar, but that projects would never come forward, with investors losing money. Other comments claimed the practice of scams and also debts contracted by Alberto Wong, also known as Tim Wong, who would not have been paid. The crime of defamation is punished with a prison sentence that can reach six months or 240 days of fine. However, depending on certain conditions, the penalty may reach two years in prison or imply a fine that can reach 360 days and will never be less than 120 days. At the age of 40, Alberto Wong is a candidate for the first time to Hemiciclo and leads the only one of the eight lists of direct suffrage that is not represented in the Legislative Assembly. The lists have not yet been permanently accepted and are being evaluated by the State Security Defense Commission. The results of the political assessment will be presented on July 15.

item.title: Elections | 13 campaign complaints received ahead of time
item.description:
CAEAL yesterday revealed the number of complaints related to "electoral propaganda before the campaign began." The penalty provided for in the law punishes infractors with fines ranging from 2,000 to 10,000 patacas
Until yesterday, the Commission of Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal) received a total of 13 complaints related to the execution of electoral propagate during a period of prohibition. The numbers were updated yesterday in a press conference by Caeal President Seng Ioi Man. "We are on the 12th day of the illegal advertising period or prohibition of advertising. So far, we have received 13 complaints. And we have paid close attention to these cases," said Seng Ioi Man. "We will follow the complaints seriously and we will cooperate with the competent authorities to follow these cases. If there is in fact advertising, we will give due treatment," he added. According to the electoral law, electoral propaganda prior to the start of the election campaign is punished with a fine ranging from 2,000 to 10,000 patacas, so it is not one of the offenses in which the law obliges the granting of imprisonment, regardless of the severity of the offense. Seng Ioi Man also revealed that CAEAL's analysis of the candidate list did not find out any offense until yesterday had to be supplied. "At this stage, the work of verification of the applications are running in an orderly manner. We currently do not verify any procedural irregularity or the eligible candidates, so there is no need for any candidacy to supply aspects of the list," said the president of Caeal However, the Electoral Commission is still waiting for the State Security Defense Commission to take advantage of candidates, assessing whether they are patriotic and faithful to MSAR. "Regarding candidates who advocate or not the basic law, who are faithful or not to the MSAR, it is up to the State Security Defense Committee to determine. If uncomfortable are verified, this commission issues a binding opinion," he said. "CAEAL, based on the opinion of this committee, will take by July 15 the decision to verify the candidates and disclose all the results," he said. More voting places Yesterday's conference also served for Caeal to announce that, for the first time, for the indirect suffrage, two voting assemblies will be installed. In these elections only the representatives of local associations vote and the first assembly will be in the traditional place, the Macao Polytechnic University Polydestive Pavilion. In this place they will be able to vote the associations of industrial, commercial and financial sectors, work sector and sectors of social and educational services. The second voting assembly will be located at the Kao Yip School School, and will receive the votes of the professional sector and the cultural and sports sectors. Regarding direct suffrage the 35 voting assemblies of the previous year will be maintained. The polls will be open on September 14 from 09h to 21h.

item.title: Works | Revitalization of the pier 23-25 ​​and Patio of eternal happiness later this year
item.description:
There are six historical areas to revitalize with the support and investment of the six game operators, but the deputies question the absence of news about what is being done and the slowness of the projects. The government assured that between the end of the third quarter and beginning of the fourth will be released more data and completed revitalizations of old zones
The revitalization of the 23-25 ​​quay in the interior port area and the eternal happiness courtyard should be completed later this year, being interconnected with the projects designed and funded between the executive and the six game operators for six ancient Macao zones. The warranty was given yesterday by the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP. "The revitalization of the six zones is a priority task for the government, because we have to rely on the investments of the dealers. We have done studies, made an arrangement of the resources and now we know what we have. We want, at the end of the third quarter, beginning of the four quarter, to be able to advance with more details." More concretely, it was up to a representative of the Cultural Institute to confirm that the rehabilitation of the eternal happiness courtyard and pier 23-25 ​​is completed at the same time. Tai Kin IP has ensured that the government “is not stopped” while analyzing and studies. “We have already given instructions [to dealers] for the work that can be adjusted. We ask dealers to do the analysis depending on the characteristics of the zones. We will complete the structures [this year], with remodeling and restoration works, and we are working.” The secretary stressed that the type of consumption is also being analyzed in these six zones, according to the type of tourists, with "two categories of consumption, the traditional and new generations." “I ask you to accelerate” Despite the promises of more detail, the deputies mourned the lack of more detailed information. “The essentials is to publicize the projects, because the government has to conduct certain investments and guide the market. Can the government have time to do the studies, but will small and medium -sized businesses take this time on studies? Will stores that are in the six zones continue to explore the activity?” Asked Deputy Ron Lam. According to the deputy, the ideas for the six zones should result in a “transparent and publicized project to the public”, because “the whole society [has to be heard] so that all projects can reflect the market panorama”. Another critical voice was that of IP Sio Kai, who asked for a comprehensive revitalization. “Everyone expects changes in the community economy. Concessionaires are committed to the six zones, but have passed two and a half years [since the announcement of the projects]. Of course there has been transition work, but there are new conception plans and everything should be done at the same time. For example, there may be obstacles to the conception of plans, because we have the street of happiness very close to the courtyard of eternal happiness, and it can be revitalized the surrounding areas. Of the six zones? It should be noted that the six zones concerned include Rua da Felicidade, Pier No. 23 and 25 of the Inner Port; the surrounding area of ​​Avenida Almeida Ribeiro and Rua de Cinco de Outubro; the bar area near the dock D. Carlos I; Lai Chi Vun's shipyards in Coloane, and the Zone of Fortaleza do Monte.

item.title: HK | Inaugurated first museum in Asia dedicated to Cristiano Ronaldo
item.description: The first museum in Asia dedicated to Cristiano Ronaldo was inaugurated this Monday in Hong Kong, in a space where it is possible to follow the career of Portuguese international footballer, from the origins, in Madeira, to the current stage, in Al-Nassr. The museum displays the five editions of the Golden Ball awarded to Cristiano Ronaldo, in 2008, 2013, 2014, 2016 and 2017, which precede the best world player of the year, as well as signed nightgowns and boots that were used by the 40 -year -old striker during the extensive career. A replica of the house where he lived in childhood, in Madeira, illustrates the humble origins of the athlete, whose professional path can be accompanied through multimedia content relating to passages by Sporting, Manchester United, Real Madrid and Juventus. "It's not just a museum, but a cultural destination, which reflects Cristiano's mindset and his message of overcoming," said Tomás Froes, representative of the player's family office, during the museum's presentation press conference.

item.title: DANS | Alert due to the typhoon that made two dead in Taiwan
item.description: Several provinces in eastern China were yesterday on alert due to the arrival of the typhoon Danas, now weakened for tropical storm, which left at least two dead and more than 600 injured in Taiwan. According to the forecasts, Danas will pass through southern Zhejiang and then move through the neighboring provinces of Fujian and Jiangxi, throughout this Wednesday, gradually reducing their speed of the current 75 kilometers per hour (km/h) to 35 km/h. In addition to the strong winds, the Chinese authorities warned that some of the zones where the typhoon will pass may receive rainfall of up to 350 millimeters. This may result, according to China's meteorological administration, in flooding in mountainous and urban areas or in small and medium rivers to extravate the beds. Several cities on the southeastern coast of China have announced prevention measures for the arrival of Danas, with Fujian authorities to also suspend several ferry routes that connect the continent to several islands. Similarly, in Shanghai (east), located just over 300 kilometers north of the point where Danas is expected to touch Terra, the local government warned citizens to the possibility of strong gusts of wind and sudden rainfall. Danas hit Taiwan at dawn on Sunday with winds of over 220 km/h, causing damage mainly in the southern part of the island and causing more than 5,000 incidents of diverse severity throughout the territory, where about 700,000 homes felt cuts in the supply of electricity.

It is expected that the work takes 120 business days until it is completed, forcing the fence by phases of the parts of the repairs to the gap. The handwriting brushes made had their heyday during the Yuan Dynasty and are still considered among the best in all of China. Four steps are required to manufacture the HU brush, and the coat of the rabbit, the fingernail and the goat hair is used. After the fat is removed with tire juice, the hair is cut into equal sizes and enter a solution to clean them. They are then united at the base with arabic gum and after drying, united with a tile that unites them to the bamboo. With the brush made in its structure, the other phase of the process is passed. The hair is bumped to a porridge made of algae to put them together and with the wire wrapped a tip is created, the most important part of the brush. This wire that goes through the hair, on a lap gives the cone shape and also serves to remove the excess of the agglutinator papa. With extreme patience and skill, the brushes are clean, rounded, creating a tip, with good elasticity. Then the brush, ready, passes to the hands of another employee, where in the bamboo cable are recorded the characters Tian Kuan Trade Mark, which replaced the old “double goat” brand. The goat hair (HAO) brushes (HAO) are soft and serve to write small characters, rabbit hair are hard and those of the fingernail are between the two, with great elasticity for the handwriting of large characters. Sometimes a mixture of different hair is made, using those of other animals. There are brushes of all kinds of sizes, serving some to paint and others to call. The best for Chinese handwriting are the rabbit and goat hair mix. HU brushes were widely used in the imperial court. In the other part of the museum is the painter's room Zhao Mengfu with its utensils and some works, where the recorded stones are not lacking. Although the museum has a sales section, after leaving the museum and already on the street, a set of stores is dedicated to the sale of products for Chinese painting. item.title: BRICS | Seventh Cimeira ends today with focus on Trump's fares
item.description:
Since Saturday, leaders of the countries that are part of the BRICS Group have been gathered in Rio de Janeiro for another summit designed to think about the reform of institutions and inclusion of more emerging economies, as well as the fight against Trump's rates. Highlight for the absences of Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin
Since Saturday, Rio de Janeiro hosts the BRICS Group leaders, which ends today. The first day was based on the dialogue around the ambition of emerging economies to reform international institutions and the defense of multilateralism. "I think the main message is this: at the time of so many international crises, conflicts, we are experiencing a succession of conflicts that only increase from year to year, having a set of countries reaffirming the power of diplomacy, cooperation, the need to act jointly, to solve the problems of the population and not to generate more destruction, such as conflicts, it is an opportunity that we always have to take advantage," Lyrio, guide to discussions and agreements of heads of state at the conference, designated by the Brazilian presidency of the BRICS. In all, about 30 countries and nine international organizations have been present, with the Brazilian head of state, Lula da Silva leading the meeting, which has Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, South African President Cyril Ramaphosa, Angola President and African Union, the Secretary-General of United Nations, António Guterres, among others. The main absences are Russian and Chinese heads of state, two BRICS founding countries. Vladimir Putin, the target of a warrant of detention issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC), on suspicion of illegal deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia, will only participate in video conferencing. Chinese Prime Minister Li Qiang and Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov will be the representatives of the two founding countries of the group, which represents more than 40 percent of the global population and more than 35 percent of the world's Gross Domestic Product (GDP). From China with Love According to Chinese state agency Xinhua, Chinese prime minister promised to “expand cooperation with Brazil” in the areas of “digital and aerospace economy”. Li Qiang spoke on Saturday, as part of a meeting with Lula da Silva, noting that the country intends to “work with Brazil to take advantage of each other and expand cooperation in areas such as digital economy, green economy, scientific and technological and aerospace innovation”. Xinhua quotes words from Li Qiang, who referred to the fact that “China is ready to work with Brazil to continue efforts to enrich the dimensions of bilateral relations and achieve more concrete results in cooperation in order to provide more benefits to both peoples”. One of the points out of this meeting was the realization in 2026 of the year of China-Brazil culture, which provides for an intensification in cooperation in areas such as “education, youth and health”, in order to facilitate “more exchanges between peoples and strengthen public support to China-Brazil's friendship and cooperation”. “China is willing to work with Brazil to further consolidate and deepen bilateral cooperation in trade, finance and infrastructure development within the high quality cooperation of Belt And Road [track and route]”, the Chinese prime minister, who did not forget the great flag of this BRICS Summit: multilateralism. Thus, I read Qiang considered “the two countries as fierce defenders of multilateralism and free trade”, saying that “China is willing to improve communication and coordination with Brazil in multilateral structures such as the United Nations, BRICS and G20, work in union with developing countries to promote an equal and ordered multipolar world and universally beneficial and inclusive economic globalization, and provide more certainty and stability to the world. ” On the other hand, Lula da Silva said that "Brazil is willing to deepen communication and multilateral coordination with China, to oppose unilateralism and defend multilateralism and free trade in order to promote peace and world development." After the meeting between the two leaders, “cooperation documents in areas such as tax and financial matters, artificial intelligence, alignment of development strategies and aerospace” were signed.
Cuba's debut Cuba President Miguel Díaz-Canel also participates in the 17th BRICS Summit, being the first time Cuba has associated with this geopolitical and economic cooperation group. Under the motto “reinforcing cooperation in the global south for more inclusive and sustainable governance”, the BRICS Summit's agenda comprises two central axes: the consolidation of cooperation between the global southern countries and the promotion of reforms in international governance mechanisms. Created in 2009 throughout Brazil, Russia, India and China, Brics admitted South Africa two years later and since last year has been part of six new effective members: Egypt, United Arab Emirates, Ethiopia, Iran, Indonesia and Saudi Arabia. Brazil invited to this summit leaders from various Latin American countries, including Mexico, Colombia, Uruguay and Chile. The status of associate, which takes Cuba to Rio de Janeiro, was approved in October 2024 during the summit of the group held in the Russian city of Kazan, which was made official in 2025, recalled the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Caribbean country. In addition to geopolitical issues, the BRICS have sought in Rio de Janeiro in the organization's economic weight, namely in the financial domain, in which they have been looking for an alternative to the dollar for trade in the group. The host president, Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, president of Brazil, stressed last Friday the importance of a mechanism with these characteristics, recognizing, however, that the current international political context is "complicated". item.title: Cape Verde | Évora family, between Macau and the rest of the world
item.description:
Tomorrow are 50 years of Cape Verde's independence, the country from which the first levada of the Évora family came out in the 1940s, towards Macao, where he won roots. Nowadays, only one member of the family remains in the territory, the cardiologist Mário Évora
There were once a dozen Évoras in Macau, where they arrived in the 1940s, but only Mario Évora resists, with the family repeating the migrations that mark both Cape Verde and the Macanese. "We have been between eight and ten Évoras in Macau," Sports Medicine expert Humberto Évora told Lusa from Lisbon, where he has lived since he renovated. The maternal grandparents of Humberto (the last of the family to be born in Cape Verde) and Mário (the first to be born in Macau) arrived in the east in the late 1940s, with five of the couple's six children. A year later, the daughter who had stayed with her husband in Cape Verde came to Macau, already with baby Humberto. The initial plan was for two years, but the couple ended up three decades and have three more children: Mario, Rui and Maria Helena. In 1971, it was Humberto and Mário's turn to leave to study medicine in Lisbon, but not without a great fright linked to the colonial war that had lasted a decade ago. "As we went to the university we could postpone military inspection, but the papers did not come from Macao and we risk being considered refractory," said Humberto. The situation resolved, but Mario admitted to Lusa the fear of the mobilization. "We had this persecution, we had to go through the year not to go with the sides in the war," he explained. “The Shock” in Lisbon Upon arrival in Lisbon, “we were soon welcomed and integrated into the Cape Verdean student community,” said Humberto, at a time of student agitation and politics. "There were periods when it was almost daily, manifestations of students against the regime, the shock police enter the canteen inside and give some suckling," said Mario. Humberto admitted that "it was a shock, for those who came from Macau, where there was little political culture and the colonial war was seen as a struggle against terrorists." In a summer, the young man, who was integrated into a Cape Verdean group of intervention music, left with a friend "to the overseas ride out of guitar on his back." “I always remember the first time in France, that I saw the colonial war described on the contrary on television, the struggle for the liberation of a colonial power of occupation,” said Humberto. Independence When the two brothers finished the medical course, the independence of Cape Verde, on July 5, 1975, led them to the root return. "There was a movement of many of our colleagues to contribute to a new country, which was beginning to take the first steps," said Mario, then a formed cardiologist. Also because, recalled Humberto, some of the friends of Lisbon had, however, became members of the Government of Cape Verde. "There was this possibility, but the return to Macao, a place where it had spent so long, was natural," he explained. “I was born in Cape Verde, I spent part of my life in Portugal, I grew up in Macao, I am also Macaense. I am a citizen of the world,” said Humberto. Macanese are a Euro-Asian community, most of which Lusodescendants, with roots in Macau, although many have emigrated, due to the economic situation or fear created by the transition from Portugal Administration to China in 1999. From the Évora brothers, Rui, engineer, left before the transition to Cape Verde, where he even worked on the project of the Hotel-Casino that Macau's businessman David Chow built on the beach, but was inaugurated. The younger sister, Maria Helena, expert in documentary sciences who even worked in the historical archive of Macau, is currently in the City Council of Oeiras. The children “are all out” between the United Kingdom, Cape Verde and Portugal, said Mario. "Now the world is smaller and it is going where there are opportunities," he said. Humberto also faces migrations "as a natural process, not only for Cape Verdeans, but even to the Macanese." Nothing that has prevented the two brothers from keeping their ties with the archipelago. Humberto divides the time between Portugal and Cape Verde, and has been the official doctor of Cape Verdean sports for decades to the main international competitions. Mario was one of the founders-and president for ten years-of the Macau-Cabo Green Friendship Association. "We had here Ildo Lobo, Tito Paris, and my cousin," said the cardiologist, before taking a break and adds, with a smile: "Cesaria Évora."

item.title: About 97 percent of Spanish adolescents victim of sexual aggression on the internet
item.description: About 97 percent of teenagers in Spain is the victim of some kind of sexual violence on the internet, warned yesterday the Save the Children Non-Governmental Organization (NGO). The NGO released a report yesterday with the title “Networks that hold. Sexual exploitation of childhood and adolescence in digital environments”, which elaborated with the European Association for Digital Transition and which includes official data and an inquiry to over 1,000 young people aged 18 to 21. According to the study, 97 percent of these young people said they were victims of some kind of sexual violence on the Internet during adolescence, including contacts from adults for sexual purposes, unauthorized diffusion of intimate images or blackmail and threats to send intimate and sexual content. Another type of violence enhanced in the report is the use of artificial intelligence tools to create sexual content from a real image of adolescents or children (content known as 'Deepfake' or 'Ultra counterfeits'). According to the study, one in five young Spaniards was the victim of the creation and diffusion of these 'Deepfake' during adolescence, namely with sharing by another person, to third parties, and without consent, of their own nudity images, elaborated through artificial intelligence. "The Internet, social networks and technologies not only facilitate capture and exposure to sexual exploitation -related risks, but can be the means by which these violence against boys and girls are committed and allow their perpetuation," said Save the Children, in a statement released from the study published yesterday. Starter Social networks are the most frequent way for aggressors to start contacts with the teenage victims, with the study also highlighting online video games in the case of boys. After this first contact, they move to applications and messages of messages such as WhatsApp, Telegram or Discord. Girls are the ones that most denounce to be pressured to send intimate content (28.5 percent of 18.4 percent of boys), with the study that all victims had shared personal or intimate information on the Internet during childhood and adolescence. According to the study, only 50 percent of young people when they were smaller considered contact with unknown people one of the main risks of the internet and only 32.9 percent mentioned as dangerous the consented send of intimate images to adults. On the other hand, 70 percent states that it has not seen as a risk, in adolescence, the manipulation of photographs and videos with artificial intelligence. Asked the reasons why they sent intimate or sexual images of themselves, 48 ​​percent says it did not know it was something potentially dangerous, 46 percent weighed that it was normal and 42 percent sought attention, affection or some kind of validation. Alone at home In this context, Save the Children warns, in the study, for the lack of follow -up of minors; The scarce digital formation, in cybersecurity, privacy and recognition of danger situations and the intensive use of technologies by children and adolescents. According to data from the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Spain, cited in the NGO report, in 2023 there were 4,896 complaints for offenses on the Internet against children and adolescents, 1,068 of which were sexual crimes. "These numbers represent only the tip of the iceberg, as most cases do not know, in part, for the absence of denunciation and, in part, for the difficulties in detection, which increases when these facts take place in an online environment," said Save The Children Catalina Perazzo, cited in the NGO statement.

item.title: WHO | Study reveals that one in six people in the world feels
item.description:
A World Health Organization report states that loneliness is a growing problem. Based on a study conducted between 2014 and 2023, the document concluded that one in six people in the world feel alone, with emphasis on young people from 13 to 29 years old. The Southeast Asian region has, however, less problematic values
More and more is spoken of the devastating impact of loneliness as a potentializing cause of diseases. This time, a report from the World Health Organization (WHO), released on Monday and carried out by the Social Connection Commission, brings data on the problem, concluding that one in six people say he feels alone, a state that is not synonymous with being alone. Moreover, the problem is greater in younger ones, because one in five says it feels alone, which shows that one fifth of the world's population between 13 and 29 years old says it feels loneliness. The study, entitled “From Solitude to Social Connection - tracing a path to healthier societies: WHO Commission on Social Connection Commission”, focuses on 2013 and 2024, thus encompassing the pandemic, a period when most of the world populations faced confinement periods, some of them alone in their dwellings. The study was sent to journalists from 194 WHO member countries, and the data were dealt with in line with other works already done on the subject and with the support of experts from around the world, including from China. Bin Yu, from the Medical College Tianjin University, was one of the project participants. The report points out that between 2014 and 2023 "it is estimated that 16 percent of people around the world-one in six-felt loneliness," something that "affects all ages and regions." However, it is a “more common feeling among adolescents and young adults”, with a rate of 20.9 percent of young people between 13 and 17 years old, while the rate reduces slightly to 17.4 percent in the case of young adults from 18 to 29 years. The feeling of loneliness "decreases with age", and is also "more common in low-income countries, where almost one in four people (24 percent) claimed to feel lonely." The WHO study also points out that “the highest rates are in the WHO African region”, with 24 percent; Following the regions of the Eastern Mediterranean (21 percent), and in Southeast Asia this feeling is less felt by respondents, registering only 18 percent. "The European region has the lowest rate, with about ten percent," says WHO, which distinguishes loneliness of social isolation. In this field, “data is more limited”, but the isolation of the elderly stands out. "Estimates suggest that 25-34 percent of the elderly are socially isolated," it is data on the years between 1990 and 2022. When it comes to adulthood, from 30 to 59 years, the percentage of people who feel only low to 15.1 percent, and in people 60 years or older, with 11.8 percent. Regarding gender, “estimated rates of loneliness in women and men are similar (16.1 and 15.4 percent, respectively), with the highest estimated differences between adolescents (24.3 percent between women and 17.2 percent between men) and the elderly (13 percent between women and 9.9 percent among men)”. Who else feels The report states that nowadays “social disconnection is widespread in all regions and in all age groups”, with consequences that are “serious and underestimated, affecting mortality, physical and mental health, well-being, education, economy and society in general”. "Its widespread occurrence and its serious consequences make it a serious issue of global public health," it is mentioned. And who feels more alone? The WHO highlights “marginalized groups”, namely “people with disabilities, lesbians, gay, bisexual, transgender, intersex, queer (or sometimes in question) and other individuals (LGBTIQ+) and migrants”. These people “are more likely to feel loneliness and isolation than other groups”, making it the caveat that “previous data are too limited to determine whether social isolation and solitude rates have increased or decreased”. In the case of disabled people, scenarios persist such as being unable to “access social facilities and take advantage of opportunities due to physical barriers in buildings, limited access to transportation and lack of affordable information and communication, while others face structural stigma that limits their job opportunities or other sociocultural barriers that lead to lower level of education, less stable relationships and more precarious housing conditions”. "Many factors" are identified that lead people to feel alone, namely "modernization, industrialization and technological changes", and may be "responsible for what, often, it is presumed to be an increase in social isolation and loneliness, but most remain without proof." "We know that certain factors increase the risk of individuals suffering from social disconnection. These include poor physical or mental health (especially depression), personality traits such as neuroticism, not having a partner or being single, living alone and characteristics of the built environment, such as poor access to public transport. The impact of digital technology is not yet clear, but experts recommend caution, especially to protect the mental health and well-being of young people." study. The WHO highlights, throughout the text, how it is difficult to quantify feelings of loneliness, being relatively recent this type of definitions and, above all, differentiation between the feeling of feeling alone and being effectively only. The report includes testimonies from people from various countries and cultures that describe that, even though they are with a partner or friends, they feel alone in a scenario caused by many factors. In the case of young people, "the finding of high loneliness rates between adolescents is consistent with the results of previous research, although the result may be subject to both developmental and methodological considerations." “As loneliness results from a perceived discrepancy between real and desired or expected social connections, the highest rate in adolescence can be due to higher expectations of social connections during the development phase, which is marked by significant emotional and psychological changes. The elderly report comparatively greater satisfaction with their social relations. According to these estimates, the elderly have the lowest loneliness rates, which contradicts previous studies that enhanced the elderly as the age range with some of the highest rates. This may be due to the limited availability and quality of the previous data on the elderly, ”is explained. The study highlights, however, that it is “possible that the prevalence of loneliness is greater among adults over 80 or older”, which is a “consistent conclusion with previous studies, in which there was a distribution in the form of 'U' of loneliness among older adults”. More than 800 thousand deaths We are in an era where so -called social health is at risk, being considered by WHO as "a vital but often neglected, health, as essential as physical and mental health." "Social relations can reduce the risk of disease, increase life expectancy and strengthen the fabric of communities and society. Social relations improve life, giving us meaning and a feeling of belonging," it is also read, being mentioned that today loneliness affects one in six people worldwide and causes "about 871,000 deaths annually (2014-2019)". "New estimates suggest that loneliness alone may be responsible for about 871,000 deaths a year. The economic cost of these comprehensive impacts on society is just starting to be understood. Estimates suggest substantial costs for employers, health systems and individuals. Stronger social connections provide important protection in health, social and economic domains," he reads. The report points out that many of these issues only now begin to be perceived and analyzed. "This has probably been happening for years, but the pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (Covid-19) and the growing concern for digital technology has brought more attention to the issue, including governments," he is explained. The WHO also points to a correlation between poverty or low income and the feeling of loneliness. "In general, the lower the performance group in a country, the higher the solitude rate. It is estimated that low-yielding countries have the higher (24.3 percent), followed by medium-low-yield countries (19.3 percent), medium-high performance countries (12.1 percent) and high-performance countries (10.6 percent)," he can be read. Despite some worrying scenarios, WHO leaves some suggestions and even says that "there is hope" to get around the problem. "There are effective strategies for promoting social connection and these must be expanded," for example, by the "regular monitoring of the prevalence of social connection, social isolation and solitude at the global, regional and national level." This monitoring should be viewed as "a high priority", allowing "to track progress and measure the impact of strategies to deal with the issue." It is also suggested the “international development and adoption of reliable measuring instruments, interculturally valid for social connection, social isolation and loneliness”, and as a priority ”should be viewed the creation“ of an instrument to measure social connection, as conceived in this report: in the three dimensions of structure, function and quality ”. The study was based on reference documents on global and regional estimates of the prevalence of loneliness and mortality due to loneliness, “the first of this type”; a global review of political documents; Network mapping and analysis, the inclusion of 64 experiences experienced by people in relation to social connection, social isolation and loneliness, as well as “high quality evidence, prioritizing systematic revisions, meta-analysis and large-scale multinational studies”, without forgetting the experience of the WHO technical advisory group itself, “composed of 20 renowned global experts”.

item.title: China-Portuguese | Chengdu Pavilion shows Portuguese products
item.description:
In the Euro-Asia National Commodity Pavillion venture in Chengdu, pavilions for foreign countries and entrepreneurs who want to establish business in China are installed. Portugal is also there, represented by the Portugal Pavilion, but according to manager Ângelo Sousa, there is a lack of support from the Portuguese government and strength to combat competition
“For us there are no barriers between Portugal and China. We are 365 days here and there.” This is the way the objectives of the team that is behind the Portugal Pavilion present at the Euro-Asia National Commodity Pavillion are presented in Chengdu and which is managed by two partners: Yinhui Tui and Ângelo Freitas de Sousa. The two realized that the Shanghai zone had reached a saturation point in the trade of products and that it was necessary to go more to the interior of the country to try to sell things as Portuguese as wine, cod or olive oil. HM talked to Yinhui Tui about this project on the fringes of a lunch in Lisbon by the Friends of the New Seda Route Association, chaired by Fernanda Ilhéu. The event served precisely for Yinhui Tui to present the objectives of the Portugal Pavilion and try to capture business interests. “This is a very important market for Portuguese products. In China we have separated the country [in commercial terms] in four markets. We have the region of Beijing and Shanghai, which we call 'Yangtze River Economic Zone', and 'Pearl River Economic Zone'. The fourth zone is composed by the cities of Chengdu and Chongqing and which is a new economic area established in 2020. Portuguese have a lot of potential in these markets, ”he said. The entrepreneur recalls that the marketing of Portuguese products is still below the one that is done by French, Spanish or other countries, but when the Chinese buyer discovers wine or olive oil, he is surprised. "In Shanghai, for example, some customers already have their opinion on French or Australians. But many think that Portuguese products have more quality," said Yinhui Tui, noting that in the area where the Portugal Pavilion operates in Sichuan province, "people are a little more conservative and prefer to try, prove and feel before buying." "Our pavilion is next to the French pavilion and we often see customers opt for French wine. But when they go through our pavilion, they see our brands and ask what we have. When they realize that we have cheaper wine compared to French, they are surprised and say it is better, and then buy." This responsible explains that the population in the fourth economic zone is 130 million people, much more than the number of people living in the Iberian Peninsula. "Then I think it's a market with a lot of potential," he said. The Role of Lusosino Yinhui Tui and Ângelo Freitas de Sousa created Lusosino that it acts as the managing entity of the pavilion, which was born “with the intention of promoting Portuguese products in the Great Market of China”. Thus, there is a “showroom” of very Portuguese products, representing some brands known as is the case of Vieira crackers, Esporão wine, Sal Marnoto, the Prisca jams or Vista Alegre, among others. It is in this pavilion that "exhibitors display the best products, buyers discover trends and where they both find the conditions to realize business." Moreover, Lusosino, through this pavilion, helps Portuguese entrepreneurs in marketing campaigns and in the best way to contact potential Chinese customers. Specifically, Lusosino promises to perform “producer and brands records, commercial representation, market analysis, market support and preparation, among other services”, reads on the website. However, and according to Ângelo Freitas de Sousa to HM, there are many obstacles to putting Portuguese products in China. “[The Chengdu and Chongqing zone] has the advantage of being a growing market that is not overloaded with exporters and has no addictions as happens in the Shanghai zone. It is a very large market and where there are many producers.” By addictions, the entrepreneur refers to “competition” from other countries and buying habits of Chinese customers, who are faster looking for products from other nationalities than from Portugal. "There are habits of certain brands that are implemented and people don't even look at others or experience them." The Portuguese Pavilion project began with an idea of ​​Ângelo Ferreira de Sousa, who has a Chinese wife who helps him in the business. “I met Yinhui Tui, he liked Portuguese products, we were friends and then we ended up joining energy,” he said, explaining that the interior of the country is still knowing foreign products, not just Portuguese. "The Shanghai zone has nowhere to grow and this is a growing economic zone. There are many factories that are moving to Chengdu, so there will be more development," he said. Absence of marketing The Portuguese entrepreneur regrets that the Portuguese authorities have given little support to the project, except for any follow -up by AICEP - Agency for Investment and Foreign Trade of Portugal. "All the investment was made by us and we have not had a lot of support. We had some help from AICEP, but nothing special. We do fairs, the showrooms, to prove and know our products in major cities," said Angelo Ferreira de Sousa. The entrepreneur also regrets that, despite the relationship of hundreds of years between Portugal and China, there is still flaws in the commercial strategy for the export of Portuguese products in the country. "The Spaniards are much further ahead than us," he said. Regarding the role of Macao as a platform, the entrepreneur says it is equally difficult to bring products from Portugal to China or Macau to China, due to lack of customs agreements and little flexibility. "It is not because we call Macau that I can, for example, putting sausages, cod or preserves in China, or other Portuguese products. To pass from Portugal to Macau is easy, but it is no longer so easy to take after Portuguese products from Macau to China. We have not been able to do much through Macau, but we have not sought much," he said. At the presentation in Lisbon, Yinhui Tui advanced some figures behind the construction of the Euro-Asia National Commodity Pavillion, and help to understand their size: about 70 billion euros of investment and a space of 300,000 cubic meters. The Portugal Pavilion does not only do contact sessions or fairs: if a businessman wants to leave tons of products there, he can do so. Then the pavilion is in charge of distribution through several areas of China. “In the southern market, closer to Macao, there is a lot of competition in some areas, so it should be betting inside China,” said Yinhui Tui, referring to the potential and factor novelty that exists in some areas of the country regarding commerce.

item.title: Coloane | Filipe Afonso launches work that highlights the importance of staff houses
item.description:
The latest book by Filipe Afonso, coordinator of the Architecture course at the University of São José, looks at a housing model at risk of disappearing, but can be seen in Coloane, or in old fishing zones of Hong Kong. “Coloane Grammar” presents alternative solutions for the reuse of these houses and their classification as a heritage
Taking the idea of ​​grammar that names the book, what are the main terms or concepts around Coloane, its tradition and preservation, which can enumerate? The “grammar” of the book introduces the concept of vernacular architecture, which reflects the knowledge of the informal, local construction and the maritime identity of this Coloane community. It addresses the assets at risk, proposing a method of cataloging existing houses, this digital method, which establishes a dialogue between tradition and modernity to preserve this cultural landscape. What concrete proposals are suggested in the book for the protection and preservation of Coloane's stilts? The book proposes (indirectly) the classification of stilts as a heritage to give them legal protection. By cataloging existing stilts, the book contributes to preserving the memory of this type of architecture and a broader discussion about its possible protection. How could we reuse the stilts taking into account these specific ways of life and the economic diversification that the government wants to achieve? The stilts could be reused for experience tourism, or centers of cultural interpretation, valuing local history. They can be transformed into creative and artistic spaces or in fact propose new wood buildings along the waterline, with various uses and that can generate value to the Coloane community, contributing to Macao's cultural and economic diversification. Why approach Coloane and the stilts? How did this project come about? Coloane and the stilts were approached by their architectural and cultural uniqueness, representing a threatened memory and identity of Macao. This assets at risk has a significant potential. The project also emerged from the gap of scientific knowledge about these structures and the urgent need for documentation, consolidating itself as an academic-scientific investigation. In the Asian or Southeast Asian context, are the coloane stilts or not unique in architectural terms? Water constructions are common in various Asian countries, Coloane's stilts are not a unique case in terms of existence. See the example, in Hong Kong, of the well-known Tai o village, but are unique in their specific context. Its architecture is the reflection of local regional influences and materials, adapted to the history of the evolution of Colona's fishing community and the development of Macao. Its value lies in its particular architectural language and its persistence in a rapidly transformed urban environment. What is the story behind the emergence of stilts? Are you associated with Coloane piracy reports, for example, which refer to the early twentieth century? The stilts emerged as a practical and functional solution to the sea -related way of life, allowing sea access, tidal protection and efficient use of space in coastal areas. Piracy reports in Coloane were not the direct cause of their emergence. Shapes are essentially the response of an informal architecture of local communities to adapt to the maritime environment. Museum Idea on Coloane Stop Stand since 2017 The need for preservation of coloane stilts is not a recent idea. Between 2017 and 2018, the Directorate of Tourism Services proposed the creation of a museum entirely dedicated to the stories of these dwellings arranged in Rua dos Navegantes, but the project was being postponed for legal reasons. In 2018, the Tribuna de Macao newspaper (JTM) published an article where it referred precisely the absence of “legal foundations” for the construction of new infrastructure in the Maritime area of ​​Macao, something that has changed, however, given that the MSAR passed, from 2018, to include in its jurisdiction the management of 85 square kilometers of maritime zones. Last year alone, the executive's plans for the creation of a “functional maritime zoning”, “maritime areas” and other related laws, and a concrete decision on what will be made on what will be made on the stilts. Both zoning and plan will be defined for a temporal period by 2040. One of the objectives of the executive is environmental and ecological preservation, as well as certain experiences of the population. One of the points of the public consultation report speaks of “optimizing ocean exploration modalities according to Macau's development needs; coordinating the use of sea in production, daily life of the population and ecology” and performing “intensive and economizers uses to realize the rational allocation of maritime resources”. In 2018, according to the JTM, STD assured that it would be necessary to “wait for the publication of the maritime area and administrative regulation on the administration of the use of maritime zones” and only then could you think of the planning of the museum. HM questioned STD of this article, and until the closing of this edition, obtained new clarifications. A gradual development In a master's dissertation in architecture, defended in 2023 at the University of Coimbra, Ana Rita Rodrigues made the study of the “Evolution of Macao Territory-Aterros and Urban Design in the Taipa and Coloane islands”, and concluded that “Portuguese occupation in the islands of Taipa and Coloane brought improvements in infrastructure, safety and village organization”. In the late nineteenth century, "there were already, in the islands, schools, hospitals and basic infrastructure, promoting the economic growth of the region." Referring to the existence of stilts “used for the construction of fishing and housing boats for fishermen, naturally facing the river”, in a coloane zone composed “by precarious housing of one or two floors, unlike the type of common housing found in mud or macau, which was more focused on high development”. The author also points out that “development was slower” in Coloane, as well as the absence, on both islands, of “a unified general plan and the need for better urban planning to ensure a cohesive and sustainable environment”.

item.title: Elections | Alberto Wong complains about defamation campaign
item.description:
The social worker also states that he has filed a complaint with the Judicial Police, after starting to circulate online comments that connect him to investments with investments in Myanmar and the debts left to pay
Alberto Wong, a candidate for deputy who leads the Liveliod Popular Strength list in Macao, claims to be the victim of a defamation campaign on social networks, after some comments accuse him of having practiced mockery or leaving debts to pay. In a publication on social networks, the social worker also revealed that he filed a complaint to the Judicial Police (PJ). "The statements to circulate on social networks aimed at my person have been made with malice and are slanderous, so they severely violate my personal dignity. Therefore, there are suspicions that the perpetrators committed the crimes of defamation and injury," wrote Alberto Wong. "I already denounced the cases to the PJ and delivered with the complaint the materials published online. The criminal case has already been installed," he said. According to Wong, the PJ will now start an investigation and follow the tracks left by the profiles that made the comments considered defamatory by the candidate. At the same time, Alberto Wong appealed to those who published the controversial comments to remove them immediately from the internet and apologize to him to “mitigate the impact” of the accusations he considers to be slander. New candidate In recent days, with the approaching elections to the Legislative Assembly of September 14, online comments came up with Albert Wong to Burla schemes. Some of the accusations claimed that Wong would have promoted real estate investments in Myanmar, but that projects would never come forward, with investors losing money. Other comments claimed the practice of scams and also debts contracted by Alberto Wong, also known as Tim Wong, who would not have been paid. The crime of defamation is punished with a prison sentence that can reach six months or 240 days of fine. However, depending on certain conditions, the penalty may reach two years in prison or imply a fine that can reach 360 days and will never be less than 120 days. At the age of 40, Alberto Wong is a candidate for the first time to Hemiciclo and leads the only one of the eight lists of direct suffrage that is not represented in the Legislative Assembly. item.title: Elections | 13 campaign complaints received ahead of time
item.description:

Until yesterday, the Commission of Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal) received a total of 13 complaints related to the execution of electoral propagate during a period of prohibition. "We will follow the complaints seriously and we will cooperate with the competent authorities to follow these cases. If there is in fact advertising, we will give due treatment," he added. According to the electoral law, electoral propaganda prior to the start of the election campaign is punished with a fine ranging from 2,000 to 10,000 patacas, so it is not one of the offenses in which the law obliges the granting of imprisonment, regardless of the severity of the offense. Seng Ioi Man also revealed that CAEAL's analysis of the candidate list did not find out any offense until yesterday had to be supplied. "At this stage, the work of verification of the applications are running in an orderly manner. We currently do not verify any procedural irregularity or the eligible candidates, so there is no need for any candidacy to supply aspects of the list," said the president of Caeal However, the Electoral Commission is still waiting for the State Security Defense Commission to take advantage of candidates, assessing whether they are patriotic and faithful to MSAR. "Regarding candidates who advocate or not the basic law, who are faithful or not to the MSAR, it is up to the State Security Defense Committee to determine. If uncomfortable are verified, this commission issues a binding opinion," he said. "CAEAL, based on the opinion of this committee, will take by July 15 the decision to verify the candidates and disclose all the results," he said. More voting places Yesterday's conference also served for Caeal to announce that, for the first time, for the indirect suffrage, two voting assemblies will be installed. In these elections only the representatives of local associations vote and the first assembly will be in the traditional place, the Macao Polytechnic University Polydestive Pavilion. In this place they will be able to vote the associations of industrial, commercial and financial sectors, work sector and sectors of social and educational services. The second voting assembly will be located at the Kao Yip School School, and will receive the votes of the professional sector and the cultural and sports sectors. Regarding direct suffrage the 35 voting assemblies of the previous year will be maintained. The polls will be open on September 14 from 09h to 21h.

item.title: IAO Hon | Owner denounces bad conditions of apartment
item.description: Plaster falling from the ceiling and iron beams on display. This was the scenario described by an apartment owner in the Son Lei Building, one of the Iao Hon neighborhood buildings waiting for Macao Urban Renewal, whose beginning was scheduled for last year. Speaking to the Macao Macao Forum Morning Program of Radio Macao, the resident, from a nickname Lai, revealed dissatisfaction with the delay of the authorities and asked to be announced as soon as possible the calendar for the reconstruction works of the building where he lives. Another situation that concerns the resident is the delay in announcing the amount of income that will have to pay when moving to the temporary housing apartment, available to residents of IAO Hon buildings subject to urban renewal. It is recalled that the building where they will be temporarily housed will be in Lot P do Areia Preta, in the building built on the ground where the Pearl Horizon project was erected. Not only does Lai not know the income of the temporary house, but he doesn't know when he will have to move.
