item.title: Promote moderately diversified economic development
item.description: Macao opportunities and responsibilities from the perspective of young entrepreneurship Wun Kong Law * Kacee Ting Wong ** It is a widely recognized fact that the Macao game sector is under increasing pressure from the emergence of new game centers in neighboring regions. Even more worrying is the so -called “exclusion effect” caused by the excessive preponderance of the game industry, which makes it difficult to attract talent and the growth of game -related sectors, generating structural imbalances and obscuring the prospects of sustainable economic development. At this key transition moment, Macao must break decisively with the habit of rooted dependence over the years and adopt an innovation posture and initiative to promote moderate economic diversification. This way is not just the right way to ensure robust long-term development, but it is an inevitable strategic choice for Macao to be proactively in the new competitive scenario. The strong commitment of the Government of the Special Administrative Region (MSAR) in the development of Mountain Island (Hengqin) and support for local entrepreneurs demonstrates that economic diversification has become one of the priorities of current governance. For a long time, the high profits from the game sector generated, in some individuals and local companies, a dependence mindset, leading to a passive attitude of waiting for opportunities within the game's value chain, to the detriment of an active exploitation of new emerging sectors. This conservative mindset, resembling invisible currents, not only limits Macao's progress on the way to economic diversification and social innovation, but also weakens its ability to resistance to external shocks. It deserves attention that certain companies remain too faithful to their traditional operational models, neglecting the formation of their innovation capacity and improving their adaptation to market dynamics. Once the external environment changes, they are severely affected, highlighting the urgency of transforming mental models and welcoming a culture of renewal. Therefore, we argue that the commitment of business fabric in promoting economic diversification is as essential as - or even more pressing - the efforts of the government government to reduce the dependence of the game sector. Young local entrepreneurs and small and medium enterprises should assume a central role, breaking with the mindset of comfort and becoming the driving force of industrial transformation and innovative development. A paradigmatic example is that of Mr. Fu Tanglong, president of the Macao Digital Industry Research Institute and Executive Vice President of the Macao Living Transmission Association. Since the beginning of the Great Bay initiative in 2019, Mr. Fu has decided to launch himself inside China to undertake, moved by his confidence in electronic trade, actively exploring the economic opportunities provided by new technologies. Through its training programs, it assisted more than 350 small and medium -sized companies in its digital conversion and provided training in digital marketing and in -moving transmission to about 4,000 young people. This practice demonstrates well the entrepreneurial spirit that combines the courage to explore the strategic vision with the use of comparative advantages. His success experience proves that, with proper professional training and taking advantage of Macao's unique geographical position and political environment, young people can open new horizons in electronic trade, developing personal careers and contributing to the region's economic transformation. In 2023 alone, the Mr. FU -led association helped Macao's local traders reach a sales volume of over $ 16 million (source: macaubusiness.com, December 10, 2024, “the entrepreneurship journey of a young man from Macao”). Other inspiring examples of young entrepreneurs abound. Mrs. Huang Yin has been dedicated to the promotion and dissemination of traditional Chinese medicine in the territory; Mrs. Chan Nga Law, in turn, founded the company E.C. Film Production Company Limited, contributing in recent years to the development of the Macao film industry; And young talents like Leng Ka Chan and Oscar Chan Tianlan were elected in August 2024 by Macau Post as "great bay excellence entrepreneurs." These young entrepreneurs, actively exploring the unique cultural and historical resources of Macao and developing projects with strong local identity, prove the immense potential of innovation anchored in tradition. These success cases are inspired by companies to reinforce investment in research and development, valuing Macau's historical-cultural heritage and combining their traditional specificities with contemporary creativity, with a view to creating innovative products with macanese identity. The active response of these individuals to the “Moderately Diversified Economic Development Plan 2024–2028” and the Government of the Government guidelines represents, in practice, the realization of the “four hopes” expressed by President XI Jinping in December 2024: to boost moderate diversification of the economy; Raise the effectiveness of governance of the special administrative region; Build opening platforms to the highest level outside; and safeguard social stability and harmony. Strategic attention attributed to the development of Mountain Island clearly reflects the prominent place that economic diversification occupies in the current governance. According to statistical data, the Guangdong-Macau in-depth cooperation zone in Hengqin already hosts more than 56,000 commercial entities and more than 10,000 technological companies, constituting a fundamental pillar for Macao's economic transformation. The new Government of MSA has attributes great importance to the expansion of economic and commercial relations with Portuguese -speaking countries, having foreseen, in its first year, an official mission to Portugal. Secretary for Economics and Finance, Mr. Tai Kin IP, recently stressed that the role of Macao as a bridge between China and Lusophone countries is irreplaceable. It also reiterated that the region will enhance its connection platform, with emphasis on the development of the technological industry as a strategic vector to achieve economic diversification (China Daily, June 27, 2025). It is also important to mark the growing role of macanese students in Portugal, who have become dynamic protagonists of the exchange between Chinese and Portuguese societies. Promoting a renewal of mentalities requires the collective effort of all sectors of Macanese society and a coordinated advance on multiple fronts. Individual, Macao residents should cultivate a prospective view, break with conventional professional models and acquire emerging sectors specialized skills such as digital economy, creative industries or traditional Chinese medicine, continually reinforcing their competitive advantage. Companies, as protagonists of economic development, should abandon passivity, adopt a proactive posture of transformation, reinforce investments in technological innovation and product investigation, and strengthen cooperation with the interior of China and international markets. At the same time, they should seek to deepen their connections with the large bay and the outdoor markets, converting Macao's advantages as a platform into concrete business opportunities. In fact, the private sector, for its efficiency, flexibility and competitive orientation, plays a particularly relevant role in the realization of economic diversification. Nevertheless, it is undeniable that many companies face the problem of high financing costs, which can limit their investment capacity - as has been widely discussed, including academic publications such as the Blue Sky Blog of Columbia University Law School. To respond to this difficulty, the Government of MSA has launched the “Young Entrepreneurship Support Plan”, offering interest-free loans to young people with entrepreneurial spirit but with limited resources, thus providing them with substantial support. This measure translates the governance view of paving the way to youth and reinforces the social consensus that young people should take advantage of this favorable conjuncture and get out of their “comfort zone”. Most importantly, young people, who live this crucial moment of transition, must consciously assume the historical mission of leading Macao towards a model of sustainable and diverse economic development. Instead of questioning “what can Macau do for me?”, Should question “What can I do for Macau and my country?”, Cultivating an attitude of initiative and service, making national and regional prosperity its vocation. The new generation should break free from the dependence on a single job in the game sector and widen their professional horizons, betting on continuous learning and improving their skills-not only as a requirement for personal development, but also as imperative to optimize the region's talent structure and promote social progress. From the national strategic point of view, the development of Hengqin will also contribute to the deep integration of Macao in the Great Bay. The firm and continuous application of President Xi Jinping's important guidelines will allow Macau to safely follow the right path traced by national policies towards a promising and predictable future. As history teaches us, the periods of difficulty are also aptly moments for consensus consolidation and overcoming with determination. Macao is in a historic crossroads. Breaking with inertia, renewing concepts and redefining the course of development is not just urgent - it is unavoidable. In this context of transformation, we must all firmly support the policies of the Government of MSAR in the economic and social domains. Given the inevitable challenges of economic transition, the Macanese society must unite, strive with conviction in the process of diversification, and promote, with innovative spirit and social cohesion, the modernization of the productive structure. If, as Dickens wrote, the worst times are also the best, then Macanese entrepreneurs should not lose confidence in the face of adversities, but will face them with courage and creativity, adopting innovative management models capable of responding to the challenges of economic transition and technological progress. Society as a whole should abandon immobilism, face changes with bravery and turn difficulties into opportunities. Only with the concerted action of individuals, companies and authorities will it be possible to take steady steps on the moderately diverse economic development, writing a new chapter in the history of Macao - a lasting prosperity chapter and sustainable progress. *President of the Macao Legal Promotion Association and senior consultant for Think Tank “Chinese Dream” ** Lawyer, associate investigator at the Hong Kong Basic Law Studies Center and Macao at Shenzhen University, president of Think Tank “Chinese Dream” and deputy of the Hong Kong District Council

item.title: The cracker that challenges repression
item.description: Hungary has recently banned LGBTQia+marches, further deepening its authoritarian and conservative drift under the government of Viktor Orbán. This decision is not only an attack on human rights - it is also a direct reflection of ignorance and fear in the face of diversity. In response, about 200,000 people took to the streets of Budapest to celebrate pride. Under the risk of being detained and even facing prison penalties up to a year, they were proudly fearless, convinced that they are on the right side of the story. In this context, it is worth revisiting a simple but powerful didactic tool that has been used in schools and educational spaces for years to explain the complexity of human identity: GenderBread Person, a pun with gingerbread - the ginger ginger cookie. The ginger person is a graphic representation that uses this figure of American popular culture - the head ginger cookie, trunk and limbs - to uncomplicate often misunderstood concepts: gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation and biological sex. Through this friendly figure, it is taught that these four dimensions are distinct but interconnected-and that, above all, do not fit rigid binarisms. Unfortunately, for leaders like Orbán and for so many others in the world, this nuance is precisely what scares the most. In a world where human diversity becomes increasingly visible, the response of certain governments has been silencing and repression. They face him like a threat. Hungary, by banning the marches of LGBTQIA+pride, is not just denying public space to a vulnerable community - is denying its own social reality. Genderbread explains things that should be simple: a person can be born with male biological characteristics, identify himself as a woman, express himself in a non-binary manner, and feel attraction to another man. It is a factual description of human complexity. In Hungary, in 2021 a law was passed that prohibits the “promotion” of LGBTQIA+ content with minors, in a clear attempt to associate gender identity and sexual orientation with taboo themes. The logic is old and spent: if we don't talk about, you may disappear. But LGBTQia+ people are not modern inventions - they are part of humanity forever. Denying their existence does not eliminate them; It only aggravates suffering, isolation and reinforces the urgency of resistance. Europe has been watching, in recent years, a dangerous growth of populist movements that feed hatred and exclusion. Hungary is just an example of how this discourse can become state policy. Educating for diversity is the most effective antidote against extremism. Teaching children (and adults) that being different is not wrong, that the genre is not just about the binary man-man, and that love does not know rules imposed by ideologies-all this is a way to build more just and more human societies. The fear that these leaders demonstrate is no more than refusing to accept the complexity of the human condition. Their ideological rigidity prevents them from recognizing that individual freedom and diversity are not threats-they are fundamental pillars of a healthy society. Today, more than ever, we need more ginger people in schools - and less stone leaders in the governments of this world.

item.title: Highly qualified investigator delivers food (I)
item.description: Recently, the online press has widely released the history of Chinese academic, Ding Yuanzhao (丁遠昭). In 2004, Ding Yuanzhao got 700 points out of 750 in the admission exam to higher education in mainland China and joined Tsinghua University to take baccalaureate in chemical and bio-industrial engineering. After graduation, he was admitted to the University of Beijing and made his master's degree in Energy Resources Engineering. Later, he obtained his doctorate in biology at the Nanyang Technology University in Singapore. In 2018, he joined Oxford University in the United Kingdom to take a master's degree in biodiversity. Subsequently, he worked as a researcher in a postdoctoral degree at the National University of Singapore. In March 2024, the contract as an investigator came to an end, was not renewed, and Ding started working as a food delivery in Singapore. It works 11 or 12 hours a day, and earns an average of $ 50 to $ 100 (about $ 40 to $ 80) and can earn up to 254 dollars of Singapore (about 200 US dollars) on Sundays. This case caused a wide debate after Ding filmed and loaded a video on the internet. In the video, it showed the various academic certificates and advised candidates for joining the universities of mainland China, as follows: "The results of the exams are not everything. Do not get pessimistic if they do not have good grades. The good results do not mean that they will have the future guaranteed. The works are not very different. Food deliveries is a good choice to serve society and to support, just work hard that we are rewarded." In another video, Ding advises experts to pay attention to the safety of people who deliver food. Ding's case caused a lighted discussion in Chinese society. The main reason is the disparity between its academic level and its current profession. This disparity draws attention to the problem of cultural conflict in Chinese society. Since the most remote times, China has always been focused on education. Cultured people can serve as members of the government and give wide to all their ambition. Another purpose of education is to cultivate the character, so there is a saying that says “training begins with learning and learning with reading.” (立身以立學為先 ， 立學以讀書為本) In Europe, education focuses on the transmission of knowledge and encouraging students to think independently and innovatively. Universities are the bastion of knowledge and particularly value scientific research. Scientific research leads to innovation and innovation benefits society. This is the main objective of education, which has no relation to careers that many students choose after graduation. Ding became a food delivery man after obtaining a doctorate. This disparity between formation and the current profession collides with the principles of traditional Chinese culture and it is inevitable that it has caused lit debates. This case is not only a story, but also a mirror that reflects issues such as the meaning of education, social values ​​and personal attitudes. First, having passed a university researcher the food delivery, will Ding have questioned the usefulness of having obtained several academic degrees? Why go to the university? To answer this question, we cannot only consider personal experience, but a social perspective. Knowledge is a personal property. It is not measured in terms of money, but in the evolution it causes in humans. Students receive education at the university to obtain more knowledge, to inherit an “intangible” property and enrich their spirits. The knowledge obtained at the University becomes professional knowledge, so professionals, such as doctors, lawyers and accountants, have to receive university education. After acquiring professional knowledge, the right way will be to embrace a profession where they give good use to the training they received. Only with talented and specialized people can social development exist, and only with talented and specialized researchers can new inventions emerge, which is also very necessary in all societies. Therefore, students who received university education should pursue careers other than those who have not received it and it is impossible for “future work to be not that different.” Ding has a doctorate and is a person with a high degree of education. Working as a food delivery is obviously the result of a maladjustment between your formation and your current profession; This maladjustment results in the waste of talented people and society loses it. Ding's difficulty in finding a work compatible with his academic qualifications was a matter of lack of opportunities and was part of his life course. When in the future you find a work worthy of your background, you can again use your knowledge and learn to make them useful. Therefore, it is not correct to confuse the objective of education with the circumstances of life. Next week, we will continue to deepen this story. Legal Consultant of the Association for the Promotion of Jazz in Macau Associate Professor at the Faculty of Management Sciences, Macau Polytechnic University

item.title: D´ As Guts | Maria João Pereira's discoveries in “My Body”
item.description:
Tomorrow is inaugurated another exhibition of the theatrical project “D'S Endas”, which this time brings Macao images of Maria João Pereira taken in the pandemic years. In “My Body” there is a process of multiple discoveries by the photographed woman who built a new relationship with her body after this project
Covid's confinement years. A closed woman at home. A camera and the discovery of your own body. The new exhibition organized by the theatrical company “D'As Endas”, entitled “My Body”, features a set of photographs taken by Maria João Pereira during the pandemic. After publishing some on social networks, came the idea of ​​doing this project. The inauguration takes place tomorrow at Creative Macau, from 18:30, and also brings a performance of the artist. This show consists of 42 works registered between 2019 and 2024 in a mobile chamber, “from multiple representations of the author's body in the private space of the house”. According to a note “D'As As Guts”, “the set of photographs now presented expresses and interrogates the memory of the present time, mixing fiction and reality, in imagined narratives, through photography”, and can be seen until August 2. The place of the body At HM, Maria João Pereira reveals that doing these photographs constituted for himself "a small escape" in the years of confinement, having been a kind of "play with the body". "I have some flexibility because of my school of theater, dance and acrobatic, and I tried to photograph images and unusual positions, more acrobatic so to say, to have the idea of ​​movement, explore the idea of ​​being alone and confinement, being closed and being able to play with what we have at hand," he explained. It was not just about photographing the body, but "creating small scenarios and letting the audience explore everything through imagination, entering alternative realities." Maria João Pereira belongs to the project “D'As Ascens” and this is the first time that exposes the images she has taken in those years. "I make a retrospective of all this work and the search for the language of the body. I was gradually made the images and did not do every day. What happened was that I had an image in my head, looked at the site and tried to reproduce with the body. When the idea arrived trying to photograph," he said. For Maria João Pereira, this project has a lot to do with “inspiration” because “there are times when it comes and others”. "The confinement led me to the idea of ​​playing with the physical body, helped me the fact that I had some dexterity, and it was something that also allowed me to play. It ended up leading me to the discovery of the photographic body," he said. Harmonious images Maria João Pereira confesses that she was doing a "continuous discovery." "There is no [in this exhibition], an image that has been created before what happened [pandemic]. It is always a search for things that can be discovered, things they can work on. I have five more years in the face of age when I did these images, but that was not impeding to look the body in another way. It is a constant search," he said. The artist leaves the message that the images that the public will see are not full -naked, much less “provocative or vulgar”. "When a person does this kind of work has to be prepared for the good and bad. But these are harmonious images, and even those in which I have clothes, I wanted to find diagonals in space and body, so it is not just a naked body," added the artist, confessing that before "My Body" did not like to be photographed. “I undoubtedly created a new mindset about my body. I didn't photograph and hated it, until I found out that I liked to do it. It was a fantastic discovery that gave me a lot of imagination, being able to create lines and diagonal with the body. I created a new relationship with my body,” he said.

item.title: HK | Inaugurated first museum in Asia dedicated to Cristiano Ronaldo
item.description: The first museum in Asia dedicated to Cristiano Ronaldo was inaugurated this Monday in Hong Kong, in a space where it is possible to follow the career of Portuguese international footballer, from the origins, in Madeira, to the current stage, in Al-Nassr. The museum displays the five editions of the Golden Ball awarded to Cristiano Ronaldo, in 2008, 2013, 2014, 2016 and 2017, which precede the best world player of the year, as well as signed nightgowns and boots that were used by the 40 -year -old striker during the extensive career. A replica of the house where he lived in childhood, in Madeira, illustrates the humble origins of the athlete, whose professional path can be accompanied through multimedia content relating to passages by Sporting, Manchester United, Real Madrid and Juventus. "It's not just a museum, but a cultural destination, which reflects Cristiano's mindset and his message of overcoming," said Tomás Froes, representative of the player's family office, during the museum's presentation press conference.

item.title: UPM | Book Fair presents more than ten thousand publications until Sunday
item.description:
Macao Polytechnic University (UPM) hosts, since Friday, the “Carnival of Books of Macau”, which is already in the 28th edition. The event features more than ten thousand publications of various literary and academic genres in various languages, with as its theme “East Asian Culture - Diversity of the World”
Book lovers can enjoy the numerous publications for sale in another edition of the Macao Polytechnic University Book Fair (UPM). The 28th edition of the Macao Book Carnival, which runs until Sunday, is organized by UPM, by the Association for the Promotion of Reading and Writing in Macau, deliver one and Development Development Fund for the Government of the MSAR The event has this year as “East Asian Culture - Diversity of the World” and brings together more than ten thousand publications in Chinese, English and Portuguese, from around the world. According to a UPM statement, there are also “more than thirty activities, such as book releases, musical shows, lectures on immaterial cultural heritage and magic shows, among others”. The UPM Book Fair will also be reason for the organization of “painting exhibitions, book launches or autograph sessions, lectures on literature and lectures on life planning”. Mix of cultures When the event opens, Chan Im Wai, president of the Association for the Promotion of Reading and Writing in Macao, said, quoted by a UPM statement, that this event “began with the initial intention and the dream of organizing a book fair to the whole city, in the hope that, through the exposure and sale of books into Chinese, English and Portuguese from around the world, transforming the book market, interaction and dialogue between an interaction and dialogue market writers and readers of Macau ”. In turn, Vivian Law, vice-rector of UPM, said that the higher education institution "has played an active role in exchange and cooperation, with Chinese culture as the main element and the coexistence of various cultures as a characteristic." In addition, UPM is striving to explore the “deep cultural heritage and the characteristics of Macao's cultural heritage, which result from the influence of western and eastern cultures”. "Through the publications of books on the history and culture of China and Macao, as well as about the history and culture of Portugal, we disseminate and promote the excellent traditional Chinese culture among the residents of Macao, highlighting the profound exchange and the mutual influence between eastern and western cultures in Macao," says UPM vice-dean.

item.title: FRC receives from today “Diligently”, a show by Jane NG Sok Chan
item.description: The Rui Cunha Foundation Gallery (FRC) hosts from today the Jane NG Sok Chan Art Show. The show “Diligently” brings together 20 oil paintings, acrylic, digital and collages of the artist born and raised in Macao and has the curator of longtime friend Cinny Leong Sin Teng. According to a statement issued by the FRC, NG Sok Chan personifies several identities that are reflected in his painting, as an artist, teacher and mother. Through their brushstrokes, “not only have we acquired a perspective on their life history, but we also develop a deeper understanding of the strength and resilience of modern women,” says the curator and also a teacher, quoted by the FRC. "I am a mother, daughter, teacher and, above all, domestic. I am part of the working class, but I am also a painter. Like many people in society, I conciliate several roles and identities and effort to manage the responsibilities that each brings. The burden can be overwhelming and often I wonder: Why can things not be simpler?" That's why “to me, painting is a sanctuary,” reveals the artist. Life path Graduated in Drawing from the Normal University of Shanghai in 2007, and with a master's degree in Education from the Normal University of Southern China, in 2013, NG Sok Chan works in the areas of artistic education and pictorial creation, having exposed his work around the world. From 2016 to 2021, he lived in the United States, where he participated in joint exhibitions with local art associations. After returning to Macao in 2021, he founded the Number Five Studio, focusing on oil, acrylic and watercolor paintings. His works were also selected for various exhibitions and contests, including the Macao Visual Arts Exhibition, the Painting Research Exhibition with comprehensive Guangdong materials and the HIII International Illustration Competition, among others. The exhibition, co-organized by the FRC, the Macao Youth Art Association and the Macao Fine Artists Association, will be evident to the public until July 19, with free admission.

item.title: Tourists | 20 million mark hit a month before
item.description:

Made the accounts, this total registration gives a daily average of 106,000 tourists. If the average tourists visiting Macau daily is added to the city's population, visitors represent 13.35 percent of people in the territory. CPSP data also show that among tourists who visited Macau since the beginning of the year, until yesterday at the end of the morning, 90.7 percent came from the interior of China and Hong Kong. Unsurprisingly, visitors from the countryside are the vast majority, 71.6 percent, followed by Hong Kong (19.1 percent), while Taiwan came 2.4 percent of visitors. International tourists represented only 6.9 percent of all entries since the beginning of the year. In terms of entry points, the siege door border post remains the busiest, totaling 41 percent of tourist entrances, followed by the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau border with 24.1 percent and 13.5 percent hengqin. Combaging DSEC and CPSP data, it is concluded that during June and the first week of July, about 3.7 million people entered. The defendant was in charge of presenting the proposals and budgets of competing companies for selection of KLC and Donki Japan. According to ICAC, Pang confessed to receiving between June 2019 and January 2022 bribes more than $ 230,000 from Hong Kong from three companies' leaders to help them get contracts for the projects. item.title: Housing | Price index descended 1.4 percent
item.description: Between March and May 2025, the global housing price index recorded a 1.4 percent reduction compared to February to April, falling to 200.7. According to the same source, the built housing price index (218.3) fell 1.4 percent and the housing index under construction (212.9) had a 0.8 percent reduction. In the price index of built housing, the Macau Peninsula (207.3) and that of the mud and coloane (262.0) descended 0.9 percent and 2.9 percent, respectively, compared to the preceding period. item.title: Andy Wu predicts travel recovery for Japan after prophecy
item.description: The president of the Macao Tourist Industry Association, Andy Wu, predicts the return to the strength of search for travel to Japan, after a prophecy that predicted an earthquake in the country last July 5, which did not happen. The July 5 prophecy departed from a Japanese comic book book by author Ryo Tatsuki, and contributed to several Asians to avoid traveling to the Japanese country. The prophecy became famous in Asia, given that Ryo Tatsuki had foreseen, in one of his previous 1999 works, a large catastrophe in Japan in 2011. This year he coincided with the earthquake of Tohoku, which killed 19,759 people, and gave rise to the tidal disaster of Fukushima Daiichi. The prophecy even led Japanese tourism authorities to react, to ensure the security of traveling in the country. However, the impact was not limited to Japan, and the association's leader revealed that the demand for South Korea also suffered a reduction. Given the smallest demand, the domestic market adapted to offer more trips to the interior as a way to maintain recipes. Wait a little longer Speaking to the newspaper or Mun, Andy Wu explained that the impact of prophecy will last until the end of the month, because one of the interpretations points to the risk of a catastrophe lasts until July 31. However, after this period, the leader of the Tourism Association expects a growth in the order of 30 percent. Despite the optimism, Wu also explained that the Japan market will not be the main vacation destination for residents, as people currently prefer to travel to the interior of China. Andy Wu explained that the destinations that are becoming more popular are Xinjiang, Yunnan and Gizhou. At the same time, the official, indicated that traditionally popular places, such as Mongolia do Interior and Guilin, remain very popular.

item.title: Red Sea | Germany accuses China of pointing out laser to the military plane
item.description: The German government yesterday accused China of having pointed to a laser to a German military plane on a mission in the Red Sea to protect maritime traffic against Huthis attacks, adding to the Chinese ambassador. "The danger to German personnel and the interruption of the mission is completely unacceptable," said the Ministry of German Foreign Affairs on social networks, specifying that the plane participated in the "Aspides" mission of the European Union (EU) in the Red Sea. The mission aims to ensure the maritime safety of I launched in 2024 to ensure unimpeded navigation routes in the Red Sea, Gulf of Aden, Arabic Mar, Gulf of Oman and Persian Gulf. Berlin has already summoned Chinese ambassador Dengbo, but has not yet been revealed in detail about the content of the meeting. China has not made any comments about the incident so far. The Bild newspaper says that this is not the first attack of this type from China, noting that the military's military has already used western aircraft lasers to blind pilots and interfere with the electronic components of vehicles on several occasions. However, these “overshadowing lasers” are not used to detect targets for subsequent missile shots, but only to interrupt aircraft operation.

item.title: DANS | Alert due to the typhoon that made two dead in Taiwan
item.description: Several provinces in eastern China were yesterday on alert due to the arrival of the typhoon Danas, now weakened for tropical storm, which left at least two dead and more than 600 injured in Taiwan. According to the forecasts, Danas will pass through southern Zhejiang and then move through the neighboring provinces of Fujian and Jiangxi, throughout this Wednesday, gradually reducing their speed of the current 75 kilometers per hour (km/h) to 35 km/h. In addition to the strong winds, the Chinese authorities have warned that some of the zones where the typhoon will pass may receive rainfall of up to 350 millimeters. This may result, according to China's meteorological administration, in flooding in mountainous and urban areas or in small and medium rivers to extravate the beds. Several cities on the southeastern coast of China have announced prevention measures for the arrival of Danas, with Fujian authorities to also suspend several ferry routes that connect the continent to several islands. Similarly, in Shanghai (east), located just over 300 kilometers north of the point where Danas is expected to touch Terra, the local government warned citizens to the possibility of strong gusts of wind and sudden rainfall. Danas hit Taiwan at dawn on Sunday with winds of over 220 km/h, causing damage mainly in the southern part of the island and causing more than 5,000 incidents of diverse severity throughout the territory, where about 700,000 homes felt cuts in the supply of electricity.

item.title: Tianshui | Eight detainees after detection of lead in the blood of 233 children in daycare
item.description: The authorities of the Chinese city of Tianshui, in the northwest of Gansu province, arrested eight people under an investigation into a case of lead poisoning, which affected 233 children from a private day care. The investigation concluded that those responsible for the nursery will have authorized the use of inappropriate substances for human consumption in the preparation of food for children, the CCTV state television said yesterday. Two people, with the nicknames ZHU and LI, responsible for the management and financing of the center, respectively, are among the detainees. According to the authorities, the center cuisine used dyes acquired through the internet, which contained lead and were labeled with the warning that they were not suitable for consumption. Authorities reported that the 251 children attended the center were underwent blood analysis, of which 233 had abnormal lead levels and 18 were within the normal parameters. The intoxication led to the hospitalization of 201 children, CCTV said. In recent days, some parents of affected children have told local press that their children had suffered for months of symptoms such as nausea, diarrhea, leg pain or abdominal cramps and that in many cases they thought it was mild diseases until blood analyzes revealed the presence of lead. Private day care, inaugurated in 2022, charged about 6,000 yuan monthly enrollment for each child.

item.title: EU wants to rebalance relations with Beijing and avoid threats to safety and competitiveness
item.description: The president of the European Commission insisted yesterday that it is necessary to rebalance the relations with China, asking Beijing "predictability and confidence" to avoid threats to "security and competitiveness." “Predictability and confidence,” said Ursula Von Der Leyen during a debate on the relations between the European Union (EU) and China at the European Parliament Plenary (PE) in Strasbourg, France. The president of the community executive anticipated the summit between the political-economic bloc and a country that in five decades is no longer "a country of agriculture and today is an industrial colossus," and "one of the greatest global powers." Last week, Ursula Von Der Leyen met with China's Foreign Minister in Brussels (Belgium), a city that houses the EU's main institutions, including the European Commission. "We are two of the three largest economies and powers in the world […], but we only exchanged about two billion euros a day [with China]. Although the market is huge, our access is limited," he said. The president of the European Commission has described a country that made “more than 800 million people out of poverty”, but which in the international geopolitical panorama has “real risks” to the EU, which are “strategic and systemic” and “harm the safety and competitiveness” of 27 community bloc countries. "China has a completely different system from ours and tools at your disposal that allows you to" throw "the margin of the rules […], subsidies not only to assist its industries, but also to suffocate competition," said Ursula Von Der Leyen. Look forward Demanding the rebalance of the economic balance between EU and Beijing, the “unambiguous condemnation” of the Russian invasion of Ukraine - which to this day has not done, although insisting that the sovereignty of all territories has to be respected - and containment in any “influence operations”, the president of the European Commission considered that the relationship between the two sides can only move, it is only “if it has to be“ rebalancing ”. “We have been doing together for a long time, if China is ready to work with a spirit of predictability and trust,” he insisted.

item.title: Tariffs | US Secretary provides for a China-It meeting in the “next weeks”
item.description:
After meetings in Geneva and London who gave signs of approximation between the two powers, United States Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent indicated that a new meeting with Chinese vice-minister he Lifeng will soon be. Beijing, for now, does not confirm or belong
United States Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has announced that he should meet with the Chinese counterpart in the coming weeks to talk about issues such as trade between the two largest economies in the world. "I will meet with my Chinese counterpart in the coming weeks," Bessent said in an interview with CNBC broadcaster on Monday. "We had good meetings in Geneva, London. We both approached the subjects with great respect," he added. "I think there are things we can do together if the Chinese want to do it," said the American ruler. "Let's discuss whether we can go beyond trade and enter in other areas," he added. Although Bessent did not identify the homologist by the name, the Treasury Secretary previously maintained negotiations with Chinese vice-minister He Lifeng, who headed the country's delegation for negotiations in London in June. The China Ministry of Commerce did not immediately respond to a request for comment. Earlier this year, the United States and China announced the imposition of customs rights that threatened to suffocate world trade and had strong repercussions on financial markets, which feared that a global recession. Negotiations in Geneva and later in London led to the two countries to reach a truce agreement, as Beijing agreed to facilitate the export of rare land minerals, essential to a series of US industries, from the chip industry, clean energy and transport, in exchange for the survey of some of the restrictions imposed by the US. These minerals have assumed enormous importance in discussions between the two countries. Tiktok and other stories Last week, Bessent warned that the flows of critical materials had not yet returned to the levels recorded in April. On the other hand, the framework of commercial negotiations between the United States and China is far from comprehensive and there are still complicated questions to resolve, including concerns manifested by US President Donald Trump about fentanyl trafficking, as well as efforts to ensure an agreement to alienate operations in the United States of Tiktok short-video application of Chinese capitals. This agreement requires Beijing's signature, which gives the country a source of influence to potentially extract US concessions on trade and other issues. Trump has already announced that he has a potential buyer for Tiktok - an investor consortium that includes Oracle Corp technology, asset manager Blackstone and risk capital company Andreessen Horowitz.

item.title: Power Banks | Romass removes 500,000 batteries by fire risk and suspends operations
item.description: Chinese company Romass announced the suspension of operations for six months after removing nearly half a million portable batteries from the market due to several cases of fire and consequent financial weakness. The technology will interrupt production and place much of the about 690 workers in temporary suspension of functions, during which they will receive only 80 percent of the minimum wage, the equivalent of about two thousand yuan per month. Only a small group of employees will remain full time to manage the process of collecting the affected batteries. In mid -June, the company announced the removal of more than 491,000 units of three models manufactured between June 2023 and July 2024, justifying the decision with the presence of “defective separating materials” that could cause “extreme conditions” fires, according to the Shine news portal. The decision was made after several incidents on Beijing University campuses, which led at least 20 institutions to ban the use of rose products, following tests that revealed loading temperatures up to five times higher than the sector average. The case that generated the highest public attention occurred in March, when a flight from Hong Kong Airlines airline had to be diverted after a portable brand battery on fire on board.

item.title: Tariffs | Beijing criticizes United States threats to countries aligned with the BRICS
item.description: China yesterday criticized the use of customs rates as a “instrument of coercion and pressure,” after US President Donald Trump threatened to impose an additional 10 percent tax on countries align with the BRICS. "Cooperation between the BRICS countries is open, inclusive and is not aimed at any particular country," Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Mao Ning said at a press conference. Mao stressed that China "has always opposed commercial and tariff wars," adding that the "arbitrary" imposition of tariffs "does not benefit any country." The spokesman also described the BRICS group as "a positive force in the international community." On Sunday, Trump wrote on the social network Truth Social: "Any country that alienates with BRICS anti -American policies is expected to pay an additional 10%rate. There will be no exceptions to this policy." The BRICS Group, currently composed of eleven countries of the so -called global south and led by China and Russia, held its 17th 17th summit of heads and government in Rio de Janeiro, under a strong security device and the absences of Chinese President Xi Jinping, and the Russian homologous, Vladimir Putin, who participated in video conferencing.

item.title: BRICS | Li Qiang calls for the reform of global governance
item.description:
The Chinese government wants the group of emerging countries to take the lead of global reforms in the face of unprecedented changes in the scenario on the international scenario
Chinese Prime Minister Li Qiang yesterday defended that the countries of the BRICS Emerging Economy Bloc should take the lead in the reform of the global governance system, and appealed to the peaceful resolution of conflict. International laws and order face “serious risks” in a global scenario marked by “unprecedented changes in more than a century” and a growing ineffectiveness of multilateral institutions, Li, China's representative in the 17th summit of group heads and government. Faced with this context, the Chinese head of the Chinese government highlighted the “contemporary value” of the global vision proposed by Chinese President Xi Jinping, absent for the first time from a BRICS summit. "Given increasing conflicts and divergences, it is necessary to reinforce dialogue based on equality and mutual respect. And in the face of deeply intertwined common interests, it is necessary to seek joint contributions through solidarity," said Li. The Chinese leader appealed to the Block of Emerging Economies to defend independence, demonstrate sense of responsibility and play a more active role in the construction of international consensus, underlining the importance of acting “based on morals and justice”. Leading role I also considered that the BRICS countries must be on the “front line of development cooperation”. The Chinese ruler announced the creation this year of a China - BRICS Research Center, which will be dedicated to “new quality productive forces” as well as a scholarship program to attract talent in sectors such as industry and telecommunications. "It is essential that our countries promote inclusion, exchange and mutual learning between civilizations," he added. I reiterated that China is ready to work with other group members to achieve a fairer, equitable and more efficient global governance. Sunday, the first two days of the summit, marked by the absences of Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin, ended with a statement of 126 points, addressing topics such as the trade war triggered by US President Donald Trump, the escalation of violence in the Middle East and the “urgent” need to reform the United Nations, the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund.

item.title: Myanmar | About 4,000 Burmese escape to India
item.description: About 4,000 people have taken refuge in northeastern India in the last four days due to the intense fights that are taking place in Myanmar (former Birmania), the authorities of the Indian state of Mizram yesterday declared. "About 4,000 people have arrived in the last four days," an Indian police, on condition of anonymity, told the France-Presse news agency (AFP). According to this source, the combat for control of the Chin region remains among rival armed groups. These same Burmese rebellious movements are all opponents of the military junta who govern Myanmar. "The situation on the other side of the border remains tense, so we ask [refugees] not to return to where they came from," the police continued. These refugees crossed the dense forests that border the two countries to escape fighting between Chin's ethnic group armed groups, Mizoram Interior Minister Vanlalmawia said [who uses only one name] to AFP. "Many of these refugees have family members in India, so they are at home. The others are being housed in shelters," added Vanlalmawia. Prior to this flow, the state of Mizram has welcomed about 30,000 refugees from Myanmar, who has been in civil war since the military returned to power in 2021. India, which has been trying to strengthen ties with Myanmar's authorities to contain China's influence in the region, has never explicitly condemned the coup by the Burmese military in February 2021.

item.title: Anabela Santiago, Academic: “China is a reformist and moderate”
item.description:
Anabela Santiago has just defended at the University of Aveiro the doctoral thesis that analyzes how China has been positioned in recent decades as an important actor in the “global health governance”. Today, Beijing seeks “alternative mechanisms” of cooperation in the “global south” and tries to build an alternative model to the World Health Organization
Let's start with the concept of Global Health Governance (GGS). Is this a more contemporary concept or relating to the post-war period and the Foundation of the World Health Organization (WHO)? What have been the main actors of this governance until China's growth? GGS is a concept whose prominence and relevance have grown significantly in the 21st century, largely driven by economic globalization and worldwide interconnection. Although global health has always transcended national borders, demanding multidisciplinary approaches and international cooperation, only from the 1990s it was made greater awareness of it. Historically, GGS has been predominantly influenced by western powers and neoliberal values. The main actors of this governance, until China's growth, were historically marked by interventions of entities such as WHO and non-governmental, predominantly American and European organizations. One of the findings of its doctoral thesis is that China has been progressively positioning itself in this leadership. This position started specifically when and why? Yes, China has been progressively positioned as a relief actor in the evolution of the GG system. Although it is not possible to point out an exact date of start, China has evolved from a relatively isolated country to a main actor in global political, economic and technological arenas. Its growing economic and political influence also represents a change in GGS's historical dynamics, and in the 1960s China tried to play a humanitarian health care role in neighboring countries and Africa. The thesis points out that China's experience can be seen as an example of what is achievable when a state chooses its own way rather than a pre-established model, aligning itself with the 21st century prediction as the "century of Asia." Did the pandemic years influence this position? How? Covid-19 pandemic highlighted the need for global health cooperation, as well as the potential consequences of the failure to prioritize global health. The thesis explores the evolution of the Health Silk Route before and after the pandemic, indicating that the pandemic years allowed greater awareness of the need for instruments such as the Health Silk Route as the most effective cooperation platforms among nations. Although not detailed in this specific section, it is implicit that the pandemic intensified China's performance in health diplomacy and health development assistance. Looking at the internal reforms that China has carried out in the health area, which highlights as the most important? I approach, in the thesis, the reforms of the China Health System and I point out that the Chinese governance model is a unique combination of state -oriented economic reforms and development by the state, incorporating elements of neoliberalism and authoritarianism into political issues in general, and the health sector is nothing different from the rest. One of China's mentioned contributions, recognized by WHO, is its primary health care model based on the recognized good practice of “barefoot doctors” (barefoot doctors). In addition, the thesis analyzes the main reform policies and their progress and challenges in the period 2009-2018, which comprise the reforms of primary health care, hospital and pharmaceutical reform. The “Healthy China 2030” program is also an important and ambitious reference of China's domestic reforms in health, also encompassing social determinants. Is Beijing's intention to create an alternative entity to WHO, or simply create an alternative movement that can coexist with WHO, in the context of the relationship with the global south? How could this work? The thesis suggests that China adopts a "dual approach": while integrating in existing global structures, forging simultaneously alternative paths, particularly through regional alliances such as BRICS and partnerships with Global South. This indicates an intention to create an alternative movement that can coexist and complement the role of WHO, rather than a direct alternative entity. China demonstrates a clear commitment to align the objectives of the “Belt and Road” initiative with the united nations sustainable development objectives, showing their willingness to present these initiatives as complements to the existing cooperation mechanisms in the international liberal order. President Xi Jinping's view of a “future community shared for humanity”, which includes the notion of a “global health community for all”, also points to a new perspective in international cooperation. Traditional Chinese Masks, Vaccines and Medicine (MTC): What are China's products or instruments to position itself as an increasingly global actor in GGS? The thesis points out that China is an indispensable provider of global public health, essential for the product supply chain, such as masks and vaccines. The MTC is also mentioned as one of China's great contributions to global health governance, with its chinese herbal treatments, some of which already recognized by WHO in 2017. In addition, Chinese medical assistance and medical teams sent to other regions of the globe are important instruments of Chinese health diplomacy. In creating an alternative movement or reality to WHO, China may be taking advantage of the lack of full representativeness in the same WHO, or gaps in its operation? The thesis does not address directly whether China is taking advantage of a lack of full representativeness in WHO or gaps in its operation. However, it emphasizes that the work aims to fill a gap in scientific knowledge in relation to the paradigm of health governance from a non-western and liberal perspective, emphasizing China as an actor of the global south. This suggests that China seeks to strengthen alternative models that can offer more personalized health challenges, different from those defended by Western countries, positioning itself as a moderate reformist actor. How has the European Union (EU) foreign policy in relation to China affecting or influenced this position of the country in global health governance? In the thesis, the fourth publication, entitled "Challenges on the European Union-China Cooperation in Higher Education from" People-To-People Dialogue ’Perspective: The Case of Health-Related Joint Projects," explores cooperation in higher education, in particular that includes health-related projects. Therefore, despite the strategic and economic dialogue, the deterioration of UE-china bilateral relations intensified, with the commission to assume a decline of enthusiasm due to “China's countermeasures to EU human rights sanctions, economic coercion and commercial measures against the single market, and the positioning of China in the war in Ukraine”. Although challenges and tensions are recognized, cooperation in higher education, including health projects, is seen as part of a broader picture of strategic partnership between EU and China. However, it is evident that there is no long tradition of health cooperation between EU and China in higher education, and that there are few joint projects compared to the general panorama. It is suggested that both EU and China should make more efforts to align medical study curricula and promote more joint research in areas related to health, infectious diseases, among others. In the Trump 2.0 era, and without pandemic, what could be China's role in global health governance? Although the thesis is published this year, it focuses on the preceding period and includes the pandemic, where it does not speculate directly on a future scenario of “Trump 2.0” without pandemic. However, the thesis argues that China is not just a participant, but a moderate reformist force in the formation of global health standards. Regardless of future political scenarios, their growing economic and political influence, strategic health diplomacy, internal reforms and initiatives such as the Health Silk Route will continue to shape their role in global health governance. The view of a “global health community for all” also remains a guiding principle for China's efforts. Does this power of China in GGS verify more with bilateral or multilateral agreements? The thesis suggests that China's power in global health governance manifests itself through both bilateral and multilateral agreements, but with a growing emphasis on certain forms of cooperation that strengthen their role in the global south and through alternative mechanisms. Although the thesis does not explicitly quantify the predominance between bilateral and multilateral, the focus on regional alliances (BRICS) and partnerships with the Global South (which often involve bilateral agreements and group cooperation initiatives) and the Health Silk Route indicate a hybrid approach.

item.title: Macao Forum | Secretary-General says it has never discussed widening to Hispanic countries
item.description:
In an interview with Lusa agency, the secretary general of the Macau Forum, Ji Xianzheng, assured that “never discussed” the widening of action to Hispanic countries, but that to realize the will already stated by the government of Sam Hou Fai will have to be the authorities to decide a new direction to the cooperation strategy
The Secretary-General of the Macau Forum stated that the institution “never discussed” the creation of an entity to extend to Hispanic countries to promote economic cooperation similar to those that provide the connection between China and Portuguese-speaking countries. “Within the Macao Forum, we have never discussed this topic,” said the Forum Secretary-General for Economic and Commercial Cooperation between China and Portuguese-speaking countries Ji Xianzheng. The official acknowledged that, "in society, there were some conversations to discuss or address the possibility of promoting more contact and cooperation with Spanish -language countries, but at the Forum level we have never addressed this theme." The Macao executive announced in mid -April the intention of creating a center to promote economic services between China and the Portuguese and Spanish languages ​​in the neighboring special Economic Zone of Hengqin. The idea is to provide companies in Hispanic countries services in the “linguistic, legal, fiscal, verification of compliance with norms, formation, arbitration and mediation”, according to the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong. Days earlier, the chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, had also announced the intention of “promoting exchange and cooperation” through Macao between China and the universe of Spanish -speaking countries. Although Macau wants to widen focus to Castilian -speaking countries, “the forum will remain the forum for China and Lusophony countries,” said Ji Xianzheng. The secretary general clarified that the institution that directs "can contribute contributions to the greater opening of Macao in international cooperation", as is the intention announced by the new government of MSAR. Complementary forum Personally, the secretary general has ensured that he had “pleasing to work with all parties,” but stressed that this is a “decision that is up to central governments to make” and that the forum was never contacted in this regard. "Yes, I worked in Latin America, Spain, nine years in Madrid and Caracas. But this is not a decision of personal interest, it is up to politicians to make the decision," he said, explaining that the idea will be to promote the relationship between Macao and Brazil and then to other Latin American countries, as well as expanding the relationship with Portugal to Spain. "There is no limit. The Macao Forum is complementary. It does not restrict any promotion of the cooperation of the other parts," he said. According to the Macao Government Communication Office, Sam Hou Fai admitted on June 21 that he postponed a trip to Portugal, scheduled for July, and should also pass through Spain and the European Union headquarters in Brussels. Bad interpretations In the same interview with Lusa, the Secretary-General of the Macao Forum imputed to national governments the responsibility for conducting development and economic cooperation policies, stressing that the institution “has no investment projects”. Ji Xianzheng attributes criticism to the Macao Forum to an wrong interpretation regarding the body's mission. "The forum is a mechanism of cooperation between central governments. Many people think it is to the secretariat that it is up to the execution of policies, but we have a limited number of people," added Ji. "The secretariat has no investment projects, is a mechanism for preparing the ministerial conference, connecting with governments, is not a promotion agency. It has not been thought of, connects with the promotion agencies. We are four people sent by China and one delegate for each country," he said. At the last ministerial conference, in April 2024, then Portuguese Economy Minister Pedro Reis argued that the Portuguese Language China-Parais Cooperation and Development Fund should bet more on small and medium enterprises (SMEs). The Cooperation Fund was created in 2013 by the China Development Bank and the Macao Industrial and Commercial Development Fund, with a thousand million dollars, of which about 60 percent have already been invested, according to the secretary general. Action plans Ji Xianzheng has admitted that SMEs are "a difficult theme for any government" and that "international cooperation for the promotion of development and cooperation of small and medium enterprises is even more difficult. It is a topic that is being debated daily worldwide." But admitted, "here, little." "But it is stipulated in the action plan [2024-2026]. It is up to central governments and commerce chambers, promotion agents, to work together to do this. The secretariat assumes responsibility as authorized by the central governments, specifically, in the activities program," he said. Politicians from various countries, including Portugal, Angola and Mozambique, have appealed to a change in the rules of the fund's candidacy. Current rules require, for example, that candidate projects have a minimum investment of five million dollars, and the fund only covers 20 percent of total investment, referring the rest to governments or companies. Ji Xianzheng said the new fund's new direction "is committed to promoting a broader investment, with better coverage for all forum countries, [relatively] to projects that have a strategic or significant impact on the socioeconomic development of participating countries." According to the secretary general, "the terms of application [of the rules of access to the background] will be more flexible and the forms of application will also be more diverse." “Instead of being just direct investment, they are also studying ways to apply the fund, in cooperation with other funds or with other financial institutions,” he gave as an example. "This fund has an operation according to market rules. It is not a humanitarian aid fund. Therefore, it has to guarantee the minimum return of benefit. But, on that, they are very open to study, if by case the conditions of each project," added Ji Xianzheng, but to give examples of "flexibility of rules." Regarding the approximation of the China universe and countries of the Iberian Peninsula, already cemented in official speeches, economist Maria Fernanda Ilhéu, president of the Seda's New Route Association, told HM, earlier this month, that this intention is “very objective and pragmatic and can be summarized to the Macao economy diversification project, for which companies and investors are not only in Macao, but also from Macao, but also from Macao, but also from countries, but countries Portuguese Language ”. "But the fact is that companies and institutions from Portuguese-speaking countries are not being effective in responding to this need for Macao. Therefore, widening companies and Spanish institutions this invitation to cooperation seems logical to me," the economist said.
